intro: Lissanthe pluriloculata, commonly known as the multilocular lissanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassy areas and rocky habitats. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Lissanthe pluriloculata is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage and blooms.
